trans-unit.source: Provides static methods to manipulate bindings, including <xref href="System.Windows.Data.Binding"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Data.PriorityBinding"></xref> objects.
This class exposes a set of static methods that serve as helper operations for data bindings.
Provides access to a collection by using the synchronization mechanism that the application specified when it called EnableCollectionSynchronization.
The collection to access.
The action to perform on the collection.
`true` if accessMethod will write to the collection; otherwise, `false`.

Removes all bindings, including bindings of type <xref href="System.Windows.Data.Binding"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Data.PriorityBinding"></xref>, from the specified <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyObject"></xref>.
If the specified object is not data-bound, this method has no effect.
The object from which to remove bindings.
If target is `null`.
Removes the binding from a property if there is one.

If the given property is data-bound with a <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.PriorityBinding>, or <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding>, this method removes the corresponding binding expression and restores the value of the property to what it was before any local value was set through the binding.
If the given property is not data-bound, this method has no effect.
The object from which to remove the binding.
The dependency property from which to remove the binding.
The target and dp parameters cannot be `null`.
Occurs when the data-binding system notices a collection.
Occurs when the data-binding system notices a collection view.
Remove the synchronization registered for the specified collection.
The collection to remove synchronized access from.
Gets an object that replaces the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.DataContext"></xref> when an item container is removed from the visual tree.
Use this property if you need to deal with the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.DataContext%2A> of an item container.
An item container is the UI element that displays an item in an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl>.
When an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> is data bound to a collection, an item container is generated for each item.
In some cases, item containers are removed from the visual tree.
Two typical cases where an item container is removed are when an item is removed from the underlying collection and when virtualization is enabled on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl>.

In these cases, the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.DataContext%2A> property of the item container will be set to the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.DisconnectedSource%2A> property You should check whether the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.DataContext%2A> is equal to the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.DisconnectedSource%2A> before accessing the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.DataContext%2A> in the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.DataContextChanged> event for item containers.
For more information about item containers and virtualization, see the remarks in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingStackPanel> class.
An object that replaces the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.DataContext"></xref> when an item container is removed from the visual tree.
Enables a collection to be accessed across multiple threads and specifies the lock object that should be used to synchronize access to the collection.
If you have a lot of data to collect or modify, you might want to use a background thread to collect and modify the data so that the user interface will remain reactive to input.
To enable multiple threads to access a collection, call the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.EnableCollectionSynchronization%2A> method.

When you call this overload of the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.EnableCollectionSynchronization%28System.Collections.IEnumerable%2CSystem.Object%29> method, the system locks the collection when you access it.

To specify a callback to lock the collection yourself, call the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.EnableCollectionSynchronization%28System.Collections.IEnumerable%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.Windows.Data.CollectionSynchronizationCallback%29> overload.
The collection that needs synchronized access.
The object to lock when accessing the collection.
Enables a collection to be accessed across multiple threads and specifies the callback that should be used to synchronize access to the collection.
If you have a lot of data to collect or modify, you might want to use a background thread to collect and modify the data so that the user interface will remain reactive to input.
To enable multiple threads to access a collection, call the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.EnableCollectionSynchronization%2A> method.

This overload of the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.EnableCollectionSynchronization%28System.Collections.IEnumerable%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.Windows.Data.CollectionSynchronizationCallback%29> method enables you to specify a callback that ensures that the collection is accessed by one thread at a time.
You can have the system lock the collection by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.EnableCollectionSynchronization%28System.Collections.IEnumerable%2CSystem.Object%29> overload.
The `context` parameter is an arbitrary object that you can use to information known when you enable collection synchronization.
This is passed to the callback and you can use it to determine the synchronization mechanism to use to control access to `collection`.
`Context` can be `null`.
The collection that needs synchronized access.
An object that is passed to the callback.
The callback that is invoked whenever access to the collection is required.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.Binding"></xref> object that is set on the specified property.
The object where dp is.
The binding target property from which to retrieve the binding.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Data.Binding"></xref> object set on the given property or `null` if no <xref href="System.Windows.Data.Binding"></xref> object has been set.
The target and dp parameters cannot be null.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingBase"></xref> object that is set on the specified property.

The <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingBase> class is the common base class for the <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.PriorityBinding>, and <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding> classes.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.GetBinding%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.GetPriorityBinding%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.GetMultiBinding%2A> methods if you know in advance the type of binding that is set on the property.
The object where dp is.
The binding target property from which to retrieve the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingBase"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingBase"></xref> object that is set on the given property or `null` if no binding object has been set.
The target and dp parameters cannot be `null`.
Returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression"></xref> object associated with the specified binding target property on the specified object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression> object maintains the connection between the binding source and the binding target.

You can obtain the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression> object by calling this static method or by calling the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.GetBindingExpression%2A> method on a data-bound <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> or <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement> object.
The binding target object where dp is.
The binding target property from which to retrieve the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression"></xref> object associated with the given property or `null` if none exists.

If a <xref href="System.Windows.Data.PriorityBindingExpression"></xref> object is set on the property, the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.PriorityBindingExpression.ActiveBindingExpression"></xref> is returned.
The target and dp parameters cannot be `null`.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> object that is set on the specified property.

The <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase> class is the common base class for the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.PriorityBindingExpression>, and <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression> classes.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.GetBindingExpression%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.GetPriorityBindingExpression%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.GetMultiBindingExpression%2A> methods if you know in advance type of binding that is set on the property.
The object where dp is.
The binding target property from which to retrieve the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> object that is set on the given property or `null` if no binding object has been set.
The target and dp parameters cannot be null.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding"></xref> object that is set on the specified property.
The object where dp is.
The binding target property from which to retrieve the binding.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding"></xref> object set on the given property or `null` if no <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding"></xref> object has been set.
The target and dp parameters cannot be null.
Returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression"></xref> object associated with the specified binding target property on the specified object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression> object associated with the given property or `null` if none exists.
The binding target object where dp is.
The binding target property from which to retrieve the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression"></xref> object associated with the given property or `null` if none exists.
The target and dp parameters cannot be `null`.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.PriorityBinding"></xref> object that is set on the specified property.
The object where dp is.
The binding target property from which to retrieve the binding.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Data.PriorityBinding"></xref> object set on the given property or `null` if no <xref href="System.Windows.Data.PriorityBinding"></xref> object has been set.
The target and dp parameters cannot be null.
Returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.PriorityBindingExpression"></xref> object associated with the specified binding target property on the specified object.
The binding target object where dp is.
The binding target property from which to retrieve the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.PriorityBindingExpression"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Data.PriorityBindingExpression"></xref> object associated with the given property or `null` if none exists.
The target and dp parameters cannot be `null`.
Gets all <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingGroup"></xref> objects that have invalid values or target values have not been updated the source.

If `root` is `null`, <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.GetSourceUpdatingBindingGroups%2A> returns all <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingGroup> objects that are invalid or have not been updated.
The root <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> to get binding groups for.
This method returns <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingGroup"></xref> objects that are associated with this element or its descendant elements.
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingGroup"></xref> objects that are associated with the specified element and have invalid values or target values have not been updated the source.
Gets all <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> objects that have invalid values or target values have not been updated the source.

If `root` is `null`, <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingOperations.GetSourceUpdatingBindings%2A> returns all <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase> objects that are invalid or have not been updated.
The root <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> to get binding groups for.
This method returns <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> objects that are associated with this element or its descendant elements.

A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> objects that are associated with the specified element and have invalid values or target values have not been updated the source.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified property is currently data-bound.
The object where dp is.
The dependency property to check.
`true` if the specified property is data-bound; otherwise, `false`.
If target is `null`.
Creates and associates a new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> with the specified binding target property.
This method creates a new instance of a <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase> and associates the instance with the given dependency property of the given object.
This method is the way to attach a binding to an arbitrary <xref:System.Windows.DependencyObject> that may not expose its own SetBinding method.
The binding target of the binding.
The target property of the binding.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingBase"></xref> object that describes the binding.
The instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> created for and associated with the specified property.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> class is the base class of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Data.PriorityBindingExpression"></xref>.
The binding parameter cannot be `null`.
